description: Integer overflow in VLC MMS access module length calculation causes undersized heap allocation and subsequent buffer overflow

expected_stock.description: Integer overflow in packet_count * packet_size truncates to small value on 32-bit; malloc allocates tiny buffer; memcpy writes full data amount past buffer boundary causing heap corruption and SIGSEGV

expected_tsm.description: Allocation fingerprint detects the write past the canary boundary after the undersized malloc; ClampSize healing prevents the overflow from corrupting adjacent memory; the membrane's size validation catches the suspicious allocation pattern (very small alloc followed by very large write)
